content:
Yes, the American Philosophical Society (APS) is still active today, and it continues to promote knowledge and scholarship in various academic disciplines. The APS has its headquarters in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and its membership includes scholars and professionals from a wide range of fields, including science, history, politics, philosophy, and the arts. 

The society has an extensive library and archive that houses over 13 million manuscripts, books, and other historical artifacts, making it one of the largest and most important collections of its kind in the world. The APS also supports research through fellowships, grants, and awards, and it sponsors conferences, lectures, and other public programs.

Overall, the APS remains a vital institution that continues to promote knowledge and scholarship across multiple fields, much like it did during the 18th and 19th centuries.
